chapter.title: Stage Protection
chapter.para: A &dcache; system administrator may specify a list of &dn;s/&fqan;s which are allowed to trigger tape restores for files not being available on disk. Users, requesting tape-only files, and not being on that white list, will receive a permission error and no tape operation is launched. Stage protection can be enhanced to allow authorization specific to a &dcache; storage group. The additional configuration parameter is optional allowing the stage protection to be backwards compatible when stage authorization is not specific to a storage group.

section.title: Configuration of Stage Protection
section.para: Stage protection can optionally be configured in the &serv-poolmngr; rather than on the doors and the &serv-pinmngr;. Thus the white list needs to be present on a single node only. To enable this, define the following parameter in &path-ode-ed;/dcache.conf:
The file name of the white list must be configured by setting the stageConfigurationFilePath parameter in &path-ode-ed;/dcache.conf:

The parameter needs to be defined on all nodes which enforce the stage protection, i.e., either on the doors and the &serv-pinmngr;, or in the &serv-poolmngr; depending on the stage policy enforcement point.

section.title: Definition of the White List
section.para: The Stage Configuration File will contain a white list. Each line of the white list may contain up to three regular expressions enclosed in double quotes. The regular expressions match the &dn;, &fqan;, and the Storage Group written in the following format:
Lines starting with a hash symbol # are discarded as comments.

The regular expression syntax follows the syntax defined for the
Java Pattern class .

informalexample.para: Here are some examples of the White List Records:
This example authorizes a number of different groups of users:

itemizedlist.listitem: Any user with &dn; and &fqan; that match /O=GermanGrid/.* and /desy/Role=.* respectively.
Any user with &fqan; /atlas/Role=production is allowed to stage files located in the storage group h1:raw@osm.
The user /C=DE/O=DESY/CN=Scooter, irrespective of which VOMS groups he belongs to, is allowed to stage files located in the storage group sql:chimera@osm.

section.para: With the plain &dcap; protocol the &dn; and &fqan; are not known for any users.
